name: Pat's Dumplings
author: Teresa C. Rouzer
summary: This recipe was a big hit at our family reunion in 1995. Best  cooked in chicken broth.
directions: Cut shortening into flour/salt mixture using a pastry blender, fork or two knives
Stir in water to form a soft dough
On a floured surface, roll out dough very thin with a rolling pin
Cut into 1 inch wide strips (I use a pizza cutter, but a sharp knife works also)
Tear 1 inch long pieces of dough from these strips and drop into simmering broth
Cook 10 minutes with the pot lid off, then 10 minutes more with the lid on
Serve with the broth and chicken meat, if using
